intro: Calendula incana subsp. microphylla, commonly known as the dwarf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its small, daisy-like yellow-orange flowers and hairy, gray-green foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–30 cm, making it a compact and ornamental species. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in meadows and along roadsides. This subspecies is valued for its medicinal properties and is sometimes used in herbal remedies.
